entries.meaning: Prepared for immediate action or use.
examples: The troops are ready for battle.
The porridge is ready to serve.
The seed is ready to sprout.

entries.meaning: Not slow or hesitating; quick in action or perception of any kind.
Offering itself at once; at hand; opportune; convenient.
examples: A sapling pine he wrenched from out the ground, / The readiest weapon that his fury found.
Lord Strut was not flush in ready, either to go to law, or to clear old debts.

verbs.description: ready (third-person singular simple present readies, present participle readying, simple past and past participle readied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To prepare; to make ready for action.
